summary: This is an FBI Task Force Officer's affidavit supporting a search warrant application for 27 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, on August 12, 2019. It details the ongoing sex trafficking investigation, evidence found at Epstein's New York residence, and probable cause to search the devices for evidence of crimes and co-conspirators.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary target of the sex trafficking investigation, indicted and arrested in July 2019, died in August 2019. Owner of the Virgin Islands Residence (Little Saint James) and the New York Residence where evidence was found.

persons.name: MEL
persons.role: FBI Task Force Officer / NYPD Detective
persons.context: The affiant who authored this affidavit. A detective with the NYPD assigned to an FBI Task Force investigating the sexual exploitation of children and involved in the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Signed the initial search warrant, the second warrant, and the compact disc search warrant for Epstein's New York Residence on July 6-7, 2019.

persons.name: Ruth Miller
persons.context: Signed the search warrant for the Virgin Islands Residence (Little Saint James) on or about August 11, 2019.

persons.name: James L. Cott
persons.context: The magistrate judge before whom the affiant swore the affidavit in September 2019.

persons.name: Victim-1
persons.context: A victim who was sexually abused by Epstein between 2002-2005 while under 18. Provided detailed descriptions of the 'massage room' in the New York Residence, which were corroborated during the search. Also disclosed past personal issues.

persons.name: Individual-1
persons.context: A victim who met Epstein in 2003 at age 17, traveled to his properties, and was sexually abused and raped by him before turning 18. Reported being photographed at the Virgin Islands Residence by an associate (redacted).

persons.name: Individual-2
persons.context: A contractor who worked for Epstein at the Virgin Islands Residence from 1999-2005/2006. Reported observing photographs of nude or partially nude young girls in the main residence, including one with Epstein's assistant.

connections.description: Epstein sexually abused Victim-1 on multiple occasions at his New York Residence when she was under 18.
Epstein sexually abused and raped Individual-1 on multiple occasions at his properties, including the Virgin Islands Residence, before she turned 18.
Individual-2 worked as a contractor for Epstein at the Virgin Islands Residence from approximately 1999 to 2005/2006.

events.title: Epstein Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: Epstein Arrest and NY Residence Search
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested pursuant to the indictment. Law enforcement executed a search warrant at his New York Residence, discovering a 'massage room,' compact discs, and photographs.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) and pronounced dead.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James
events.description: Law enforcement executed a search warrant at Epstein's private island, Little Saint James (Virgin Islands Residence), and seized 27 electronic devices.

events.title: Miami Herald Series Publication
events.description: The Miami Herald began publishing a series of articles about Epstein's sexual misconduct with minors and the prior Florida investigation.

locations: Little Saint James (Virgin Islands Residence), U.S. Virgin Islands
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: On August 12, 2019, the FBI seized 27 electronic devices from Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, which was his primary residence at the time of his arrest.

A search of Epstein's New York Residence in July 2019 revealed a 'massage room' matching a victim's description, along with compact discs and photographs containing thousands of nude/partially nude images of young girls, some labeled 'LSJ' (Little Saint James).

The affidavit states the investigation into Epstein's co-conspirators remains ongoing, specifically naming 'Employee-2' from the indictment as a Target Subject and referencing other redacted associates.

Victim and witness accounts (Victim-1, Individual-1, Individual-2) corroborate sexual abuse of minors at Epstein's properties and the presence of exploitative photographs at the Virgin Islands Residence.

The affidavit reveals that days after the Miami Herald series began in November 2018, Epstein wired $250,000 from a trust account to a redacted individual, suggesting an attempt to influence potential witnesses.
